subject: RE: [junit] Problems migrating from JUnit3.7 to 3.8.1
msgSnippet: JUnit DOESN T need Ant at all.  It s the Ant tasks at question here. =jason ... From: Paul Michali [mailto:pcm@cisco.com] Sent: Thursday, September 19, 2002
messageBody:
JUnit DOESN'T need Ant at all. It's the Ant tasks at question here.

=jason

-----Original Message-----
From: Paul Michali [mailto:pcm@...]
Sent: Thursday, September 19, 2002 12:16 PM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Problems migrating from JUnit3.7 to 3.8.1


Jason Rogers wrote:
>
> As the NoSuchMethodError is coming from an Ant class, I would say you
> need to update Ant.

That was it. Thanks! I didn't see anything where JUnit3.8.1 said that
it needed Ant1.5 or newer. I must have missed it.

Is there any advantage/disadvantage to moving to JDK1.4 with these
versions of Ant and JUnit?
